intro: Silene guntensis, commonly known as the Guntensk silene, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its simple, usually pink or white flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions. Silene guntensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
